issue.title: Why not use more static transforms?

content.raw:
I’d like to echo this question. Running just a single X1 ground robot, I see all the TF transforms published on `/robotname/pose`. I know `ros1_ign_bridge_pose` makes this topic to get the transforms out of ignition and into TF -- but why update all the transforms all the time? Why not use a static transform publisher on the destination side for the internal vehicle transforms - those from model frame to the links and sensors in the model? That would cut down on a ton of bandwidth.

Running `rostopic hz` on this topic shows 2500Hz; seems to be publishing 10 transforms at 250Hz. Aside from the wheels \(and the base link location if ground truth is enabled\), all the other transforms here could be static.
